day22.txt:
Day 22
Monday on Route (Today's Focus: Business Operation / Customer Relations)

message1.txt: Good morning! As you experienced in previous weeks, initiating 'Start of Day' procedures in the HHC is critical to daily organization. Work the process you learned last week, from validating your load through departing from the sales center. Refer back to Week One if you have any questions.

tasks.task1: Ensure the start of day process is completed properly
tasks.task2: Reinforce invoice is final once the sales center is departed

message1.txt: Navigating your customer accounts will help in building solid business relationships. Be sure to complete all steps in the process, from invoicing customers, working backstock and new product, to speaking with customer decision makers.

tasks.task1: Assist the in-store process from receiving to merchandising

message1.txt: Understanding Scan Based Trading (SBT) is a crucial part of route operation. A count of inventory should be taken in every SBT account each week. This count should be completed on the first day of service each week. You will learn more about SBT later in your Onboarding. Complete inventories in all applicable accounts. If you are purchasing the route from another IBP, ensure they are present for these important inventory counts this week.

tasks.task1: Assist pulling returns from the shelf and displays
tasks.task2: Assist completing an SBT inventory, including all backstock and displays (Monday only)
tasks.task3: Validate the inventory counts are correct (on behalf of the company or in the presence of selling IBP)

message1.txt: Proper merchandising to DSDE standards can greatly enhance your success. Quality merchandising is your 'Silent Seller' representing you and your brands when you are not in the store. Your MSL will discuss the DSDE merchandising standards with you and help you set both the shelf and any secondary displays to standard.

tasks.task1: Explain DSDE merchandising standards
tasks.task2: Set the customer's shelf to plan-o-gram (POG)

message1.txt: Building relationships with the decision makers in your customers will aid in being a successful business owner. It is important to have regular communication with decision makers, updating them on current status and gaining support for upcoming promotional events. Assist this week while your MSL has converstations with store decision makers.

tasks.task1: Sell in a secondary display using fact based selling

message1.txt: Complete the 'End of Day' procedures in the HHC. Be sure to validate any and all truckstock, and create plans to sell that product the following delivery day.

tasks.task1: Ensure the end of day process and communication of the is understood.

day22.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with your MSL. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

day23.txt:
Day 23
Tuesday on Route (Today's Focus: Business Operation / Customer Relations)

tasks.task1: Ensure the start of day process is completed properly
Assist the in-store process from receiving to merchandising
Explain DSDE merchandising standards
tasks.task2: Set the customer's shelf to plan-o-gram (POG)

tasks.task1: Sell in a secondary display using fact based selling
Ensure the end of day process and communication of the is understood.

day23.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with your MSL. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

message1.txt: On a non-delivery day, it is important you visit your customers to work up and back stock while also pulling up the shelf and and displays. This also is an opportunity to discuss business with store decision makers.

tasks.task1: Merchandise the shelf and displays at each customer
tasks.task3: Discuss importance of proper product rotation filling in gaps where necessary

tasks.task1: Discuss how to adjust an order at the product level in ION (delivery percentage patterns, promotional activity, SCO, etc.)

day24.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with your COACH on route. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

tasks.task1: Reinforce invoice is final once the sales center is departed

day27.final_message: Tomorrow you will pull up your stores.

message1.txt: On a non-delivery day, it is important you visit your customers to work up and back stock while also pulling up the shelf and and displays. This also is an opportunity to discuss business with store decision makers.

tasks.task1: Merchandise the shelf and displays at each customer

day28.final_message: Congratulations! You have completed the 4 weeks of onboarding. Tomorrow will be your first day operating the route on your own. Remember, you can reach out to your COACH or MSL if you have questions. Good luck!
